result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy D Drake was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid over  period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Restitution set at zero.

Obtain a high school diploma, GED or HSED.
Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Comply with the standard rules of probation.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.   Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED. To be used at the probation departments discretion.
11-25-15/ Judge Jeffrey A Conen
Defendant is non-compliant with conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC.
**04-21-16/Order
Defendant is non-compliance with probation conditions and is ordered to spend 30 days in HOC, STRAIGHT TIME; FORTHWITH, with No Good Time Credit.

Dosage Probation Approved.

Defendant Jeremy D Drake in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, straight time. 
Credit for 5 days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 years under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNT 1): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE 90 DAYS "condition time" - STAYED.  To be used at the Probation Department's discretion.
* Obtain a High School diploma, GED, or HSED.
* Complete a job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Jeremy D Drake in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Jeremy D Drake in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**Court admonished defendant for receiving a Justice Point violation on 02-13-2015.
Court does not modify the signature bond or conditions of release at this time.
Scheduling Conference held.
Case adjourned to 05-12-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Defendant Jeremy D Drake in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request another scheduling conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 04-08-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Positive drug screen for THC.)

Defendant Jeremy D Drake in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Lindsey Anderson, student intern under the supervision of Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 1/23/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Peter R. or 6373 N 101st Street., Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Jeremy D Drake in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jeremy D Drake in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to a lower pending case of Co-Defendant, this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
